description: National Workshop Agreement "Withdrawal Management Services" for Substance Use Health manaement
full_summary:
# National Workshop Agreement (NWA) - Withdrawal Management Services
## Tender Alert
**Reference:** cb-5737-68084335
**Sort title:** MHSUH
**Tender Category:** SRV (Service)
**Incumbent Tender ID:** None

**Tender Description:**
This Request for Proposal (RFP) invites qualified organizations to collaborate with the Standards Council of Canada (SCC) in developing a National Workshop Agreement (NWA) on Withdrawal Management Services. The NWA will ensure standardized operational guidance and best practices for managing substance use health-related withdrawal services across Canada.

**Scope of Work:**

- Develop a NWA that addresses the delivery of substance use health-related WM services.
- Collaborate with SCC in developing an operational document that meets the defined requirements.
- Present a detailed plan outlining the scope, schedule, and methodologies for achieving the project objectives.

**Service Requirements:**

- Government affairs and community relations consultation services.
- Government relations consultation and engagement services.
- Community relations consultation and engagement services.

**Regional Information:**

- **Regions of Delivery:** National Capital Region, Canada.
- **End-users:** Canadian Organizations, Federal Agencies.

**Tender Details:**
- **Tender Status:** EXPIRED
- **Expected Contract Start Date:** June 30, 2023
- **Expected Contract End Date:** February 29, 2024
- **GSIN (National Item Identification):** None
- **Purchase Summary:** For the development of a NWA.

**Collaboration and Innovation:**

- LCS/ASP (Long Term Collaboration/Strategic Partnership) preferred
- Canadian-owned organizations with operations in Canada favored 

**Notice of Interest:**

The contract includes multiple extensions after the initial expected contract start date, including renewal, incrementally:

On December 31, 2024, by submitting a Certificate of Completion in accordance with the SCC Normalization framework, the contract will be automatically renewable for a term equal to the initial expected contract period.

Lianne Bernard  
Contracting Manager,  
Standards Council of Canada  
55 Metcalfe, Suite 600  
Ottawa, Ontario, K1P 6L5  
Lianne.Bernard@scc.ca  
(613) 238-3222**
